title: Homemade Essential Oil Spray for Rooms, Sleep, & Mood

steps.title: Pour 2 tbsp (30 ml) of witch hazel into a 4 oz (118 ml) spray bottle.
steps.content: Pour 2 tbsp (30 ml) of witch hazel into a 4 oz (118 ml) spray bottle . Witch hazel is the perfect base for your spray because of its natural anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. [1] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Use a tablespoon to measure out your witch hazel and add it to the bottle. For fewer spills, try using a small funnel . [2] X Research source If you don’t have witch hazel, try swapping it with vinegar . The effects will be the same, but your spray may have a more acidic smell. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add at least 20 drops of essential oil(s) to the spray bottle.
steps.content: Add at least 20 drops of essential oil(s) to the spray bottle. The more drops you add, the stronger your essential oil spray’s fragrance will be. Start with 20 drops, smell, and add more if you’d like. [4] X Research source Use one essential oil for your spray, or try blending two or more oils for a customized scent. Pick an essential oil or blend that matches your needs. For instance, pick a floral or citrus oil for a room spray or a calming blend for a pillow spray.

steps.title: Pour 6 tbsp (89 ml) of water into the witch hazel and oil mixture.
steps.content: Pour 6 tbsp (89 ml) of water into the witch hazel and oil mixture. Water helps dilute your essential oils and give your spray volume. Simply measure out your water with a tablespoon and use a funnel to gently add it to the spray bottle. [5] X Research source Consider using distilled water to ensure that your water is clean and free of contaminants. Diluting your essential oils is incredibly important because putting oils directly on the skin can cause severe irritation. [6] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: Twist on the cap, shake, and spray.
steps.content: Twist on the cap, shake, and spray. All that’s left to do is put on the lid and mix your spray up! Shake the bottle vigorously to make sure the oils are incorporated. [7] X Research source Use your DIY essential oil spray for 4 to 6 months or until the fragrance starts to fade. It may take a few squirts for the spray to start working, especially if this is your first time using the spray bottle. Shake the bottle before each use, as the oils will naturally separate over time.

steps.title: Brighten your mood with lemon, lime, and wild orange.
steps.content: Brighten your mood with lemon , lime , and wild orange . Citrus aromas can combat negative feelings, making this the perfect blend to spray in your office during a stressful work day or in your bedroom right when you wake up. Simply add about 7 drops of each oil to your spray bottle, spritz, and feel uplifted. [8] X Research source Play around with how much of each oil you add to your spray. If you like the smell of lemon more, add an extra few drops of it!

steps.title: Use bergamot, ginger, and lime for a natural air freshener.
steps.content: Use bergamot , ginger , and lime for a natural air freshener. The combination of citrus and woodsy aromas creates an invigorating and refreshing scent that’ll liven up any space. Add equal amounts of each oil to your spray bottle to make a chemical-free room spray. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Combine vanilla, ylang-ylang, geranium, and grapefruit for a perfume.
steps.content: Combine vanilla , ylang-ylang , geranium , and grapefruit for a perfume. When combined, these essential oils create a sweet floral scent that’s perfect to wear on your skin. Use about 10 drops of vanilla, 10 drops of ylang-ylang, 5 drops of geranium, and 5 drops of grapefruit. [10] X Research source Experiment with how many drops you add of each oil—make the perfume unique to you!

steps.title: Mix lemongrass, clove, and eucalyptus for a mosquito repellent.
steps.content: Mix lemongrass , clove , and eucalyptus for a mosquito repellent. Studies have shown that mosquitos hate the smell and taste of these essential oils. Because of this, an equal combination of these 3 oils can make a strong fragrance that naturally protects you from bug bites. [11] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Add lavender to your spray to help you sleep.
steps.content: Add lavender to your spray to help you sleep. Lavender is a naturally calming oil. It’s been proven to reduce anxiety and alleviate stress, making it an excellent oil to use right before bed. If you have trouble sleeping, try spritzing some lavender essential oil spray on your pillow to help you doze off. [12] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Combine bergamot and clary sage for a stress relieving spray.
steps.content: Combine bergamot and clary sage for a stress relieving spray. The aromas from these oils can help you feel grounded and calm. Add equal amounts of bergamot and clary sage to your bottle to create a relaxing room spray to use in the office, car, or before bed.

steps.title: Make a peppermint spray for headaches, muscle pain, or itching.
steps.content: Make a peppermint spray for headaches, muscle pain, or itching. Peppermint essential oil is known for its cooling and mood-lifting properties, making it the perfect natural remedy. Studies have shown that the presence or application of this oil can help reduce headaches, ease pain, and soothe skin. [13] X Research source Always be careful when applying essential oils to the skin. Even when diluted, peppermint could irritate rashes. Consider talking to a health care provider before treating your skin with peppermint.

steps.title: Add dried herbs or flowers to your blends if you’d like.
steps.content: Add dried herbs or flowers to your blends if you’d like. Who says your essential oil spray has to be one note? Plopping a few dried herbs or flowers into your spray bottle will infuse the mixture with even more fragrance. Try pairing oils with their dried versions or pairing them up like so: [14] X Research source A blend of bergamot and sandalwood with dried jasmine . A blend of vetiver and peppermint with dried rosemary . A blend of basil and rosemary with dried peppermint .
